data.name: E-mail address format validator
data.description:
Write a code that checks if user's e-mail address format is valid. It should return True if it's valid, False if it isn't valid.

A valid e-mail address should respect these rules below, in this specific order.

username@domainname.topleveldomain


1- User name
It should consist of at least one character, maximum 64 characters. These characters should be alphanumerical and/or these symbols: dot(.), hyphen(-), underscore(_). The username cannot end with a special character.


2- At symbol (@)
A simple @ symbol at the end of the user name.


3- Domain name
It should consist of minimum 1, maximum 253 alphanumerical characters.
The following symbols are allowed but the domain name cannot end with one: dot(.), hyphen(-), underscore(_).


4- Dot (.)
A simple dot at the end of the domain name.


5- Top-level domain
It should consist of at least two, maximum 63 English letters (A-Z).

The only special character that's allowed is one single dot, but the top level domain cannot end with a dot.

Note: All e-mail addresses in the test examples are fictional and invented for testing purposes.
